snippet: The procedure to drain a blood clot near President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner’s brain went “very well,” her spokesman said.
abstract: Argentinian Pres Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner undergoes surgery to drain blood clot near her brain resulting from two-month-old head injury; Kirchner's spokesman says surgery went very well, but no explanation is offered for injury.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT

lead_paragraph: The procedure to drain a blood clot near President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner’s brain went “very well,” her spokesman said.

headline.main: Argentine President Undergoes Surgery for Blood Clot
